intro: Dicoria wetherillii, commonly known as the Wetherill's dicoria, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
